intro: Poivrea alba, commonly known as white spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually green with a waxy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Poivrea alba is also known for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
